# customizationIdentifier

**Instance Property**

A globally unique string that makes the Touch Bar eligible for user customization.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var customizationIdentifier: NSTouchBar.CustomizationIdentifier? { get set }
```

## Discussion

To make an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar] object eligible for user customization, assign it a globally unique [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar/customizationIdentifier-swift.property] identifier. For the identifier string, use reverse-DNS style, such as “`com.company-name.app-name.alphanumeric-ID`”.

The system archives this property.

## Configuring user customization

- **customizationAllowedItemIdentifiers**: A list of identifiers for items to show in the Touch Bar’s customization UI.
- **customizationRequiredItemIdentifiers**: An optional list of identifiers for items you want to always appear in the Touch Bar and which the user can’t remove during customization.
- **NSTouchBar.CustomizationIdentifier**: The default type for a Touch Bar customization identifier.
- **isAutomaticCustomizeTouchBarMenuItemEnabled**: A Boolean value indicating whether the main menu contains an item for customizing the contents of the Touch Bar.
